intro: Geigeria vigintisquamea, commonly known as the twenty-scales geranium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive leaves with 20 scales along the leaf margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
